thread.title: Amelia Island's Elizabeth Pointe Lodge a gem of a B&B getaway
thread.title_full: Amelia Island's Elizabeth Pointe Lodge a gem of a B&B getaway | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Mary Thurwachter
title: Amelia Island's Elizabeth Pointe Lodge a gem of a B&B getaway
text:
Fernandina Beach on the northern half of Amelia Island is a gem of a small town with eight fine bed-and-breakfasts. I have enjoyed them all, but the one I return to most frequently is Elizabeth Pointe Lodge.
Built in 1992, the seaside B&B resembles a 1890s Nantucket shingle-style beach cottage.
The Elizabeth Pointe Lodge resembles a 1890s Nantucket shingle-style beach cottage. Contributed There’s always something to do, whether it’s building sandcastles, collecting shells, riding horses on the beach, swimming, playing board games or just hanging out with other guests. When it’s hot outside, a pitcher of ice tea awaits. In the winter, hot chocolate is a served and warm blankets are provided for those relaxing on porch rockers to watch the stars.
For breakfast, a bountiful buffet is served in the sunlit dining room overlooking the ocean. Early each evening, wine and hors d’ oeuvres are provided in the lobby.
Guest rooms have Jacuzzis or marbl tubs and complimentary Wi-Fi. Newspapers are delivered to guest rooms each morning, and 24-hour room service is available. Another plus for guests – especially if you over-pack – is an elevator.
The B&B has its own library, complete with fireplace. Contributed Daytime diversions include exploring Fort Clinch, a 19th century military post; seeing the sites on a river cruise; or hunting for treasures along Centre Street. A 52-block historic district stands ready to be explored, as well.
Elizabeth Pointe Lodge, 98 S. Fletcher Ave. 25 rooms. Info: 904-277-4851, www.elizabethpointelodge.com
Rocking chairs are lined up ready for guests at the Elizabeth Pointe Lodge. Contributed </span
